```{r analysis-preferences}
# Seed for random number generation
set.seed(42)
knitr::opts_chunk$set(cache.extra = knitr::rand_seed)
```


```{r include = TRUE, results = "asis"}
# Create the data frame with the necessary columns
overview_table <- data.frame(
  Citation = character(),
  Study_Design = character(),
  Population = character(),
  Methods = character(),
  Key_Findings = character(),
  Neural_Regions_Networks = character(),
  Impact_on_Academic_Performance = character(),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)

colnames(overview_table) <- c(
  "Citation",
  "Study Design",
  "Population",
  "Methods",
  "Key Findings",
  "Neural Regions",
  "Academic Performance"
)
# Example entry for manual filling (you will need to fill these with the actual data)
overview_table[1, ] <- c(
  "Beilock et al. (2007)",
  "Experimental",
  "100 college students, mixed gender",
  "Behavioral tasks, fMRI",
  "Stereotype threat impairs working memory efficiency",
  "Prefrontal cortex, phonological loop",
  "Reduced performance on cognitive tasks under threat"
)


# Adjust column widths to fit within the available width of 27cm
column_widths <- c("2.5cm", "2.5cm", "2.5cm", "2.5cm", "3.5cm", "3.5cm", "3.5cm")

# Construct the align string with centered column headers
align_string <- paste0(">{\\centering\\arraybackslash}p{", column_widths, "}")

# Create the apa_table object
apa_table(
  overview_table,
  caption = "Overview of the Included Papers for Hypothesis 1",
  escape = TRUE,
  longtable = TRUE,
  landscape = TRUE,
  align = align_string,
  small = T,
)

```
